data.title: Who is Jamie Lewis? Welshman profiled after reaching PDC World Championship semi
data.meta_description: Lewis beat Darren Webster 5-0 on Friday to reach the last four of the competition at Ally Pally
data.text:
Jamie Lewis is the name on everybody's lips at the PDC World Darts Championship.

The Welshman secured his place in the semi-finals of the competition with a crushing 5-0 victory over Darren Webster.

He will now face the winner of Phil Taylor's quarter-final clash with Gary Anderson on Friday.

But just who is the Welsh sensation? Our friends at WalesOnline have profiled the prospect.

Here's all you need to know...

Where was he born?

He was born on November 8, 1991, in Carmarthen and now lives in Cardigan.

What is his nickname?

His nickname for the stage is Fireball, but off the oche he's known as Rasta.

He explained: "I've been called Rasta by my friends for years now, people started calling me it mainly because I love reggae music and I'm very passionate on Bob Marley's music. I also used to have a big afro and braided my hair!

Darts background

His father Mark played darts in the rival BDO set-up from 2001-10 with his best finishes coming with a quarter-final appearance in the 2003 and 2004 England Open.

In January 2012, Lewis successfully earned a PDC tour card on day four of the Pro Tour Qualifying School. This enabled him to participate in all this and next year's Players Championships, UK Open Qualifiers and European Tour events.

Is this his best performance?

Yes though his best effort before this week was to reach the last eight of the 2015 World Grand Prix before losing the Dutch legend Michael van Gerwen 3-0.

Route to the last four

He started off with a 2-1 victory over Belgium's Kenny Neyens and then came a 3-0 triumph over in-form Welshman Jonny Clayton, who last month reached the final of the Players Championship in Minehead before losing to Van Gerwen.

Then came the biggest shock of the tournament so far when on Wednesday he dumped out No.2 seed, Scotland's Peter Wright, before going on to account for England's James Richardson by the same 4-1 scoreline.

He was in sparkling form against Webster hitting 14 180s for a 101.26 match average while completing 15 of 35 throws at the double produced a 42% average and a comfortable 5-0 whitewash.

Has he won any events?

As a youth player his first win came in the 2009 World Masters and that year he also won the WDF World Youth Cup.

In 2010 he landed the Wales Classic and in 2012 came the PDC Youth Tour England and Germany crowns.

He was the PDC Challenge Tour England champion in 2013 and the PDC Development Tour England title winner in 2015.

What is his walk-on music?

It's Uptown Funk by Mark Ronson featuring Bruno Mars.
